title: Digging up ancestors
brief_description: Investigates the discovery of extensive fossil beds at Koonwarra, Victoria. The beds are estimated to be around 120 million years old. Professor Jim Warren, an expert in fossil research, discusses his work at the beds and demonstrates how much information fossils can give us. Suitable for early secondary levels. Narrated by John Gaden.
